      • cloneCustomer

        public AdminCloneCustomerResult cloneCustomer(int superUserId,
                                              int cloneCustId,
                                              java.lang.String[] stores)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This API call is used to clone customers across multiple stores and is only available when in multi-store single DB, non shared customer mode. The caller (referenced by superUserId) must have at least one role with super user privileges. The cloneCustId references an existing customer in the current engine store. If a customer with matching eMail address doesn't exist in a destination store, a new customer object is inserted, otherwise the existing object is updated.

        Points to note:

        • The cloned customer has the same password as the source customer
        • All addresses and roles are also cloned
        • Customer tag information is cloned as long as the customer tag exists in the destination store
        • The return object contains an array of error messages. If an error occurs when cloning to a store, the exception is trapped, reported in the return object and the code continues with the next store.
        Specified by:
        cloneCustomer in interface AdminCustomerMgrIf
        Overrides:
        cloneCustomer in class AdminCustomerMgr
        Parameters:
        superUserId - The id of the Super User making the API call
        cloneCustId - The id of the customer to be cloned
        stores - An array of destination store ids where the customer will be cloned
        Returns:
        Returns an AdminCloneCustomerResult object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception

      • getSourceCountry

        Returns an AdminCountry object
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - unexpected exception in the KonaKart Admin Engine

      • deleteCustomerMultiStore

        public AdminDeleteCustomerResult deleteCustomerMultiStore(int superUserId,
                                                          int customerId,
                                                          java.lang.String[] stores)
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This API call is used to delete customers across multiple stores and is only available when in multi-store single DB, non shared customer mode. The caller (referenced by superUserId) must have at least one role with super user privileges. The customerId references an existing customer in the current engine store. If a customer with matching eMail address exists in a destination store, the customer is deleted.

        If the stores array contains the id of the KKAdmin Engine store, then the customer is also deleted from that store.

        Specified by:
        deleteCustomerMultiStore in interface AdminCustomerMgrIf
        Overrides:
        deleteCustomerMultiStore in class AdminCustomerMgr
        Parameters:
        superUserId - The id of the Super User making the API call
        customerId - The id of the customer to be deleted
        stores - An array of store ids where the customer will be deleted
        Returns:
        Returns an AdminDeleteCustomerResult object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception

      • getStoresForCustomer

        public AdminStore[] getStoresForCustomer(int superUserId,
                                         java.lang.String emailAddress)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This API call is only available when in multi-store single DB, non shared customer mode. The caller (referenced by sessionId) must have at least one role with super user privileges.

        It is used to search for a customer using the email address, across multiple stores. The stores where the customer is present, are returned in an array in alphabetical order. It searches all stores regardless of their state (enabled, under maintenance or deleted). This state information is available on the returned AdminStore objects.

        Specified by:
        getStoresForCustomer in interface AdminCustomerMgrIf
        Overrides:
        getStoresForCustomer in class AdminCustomerMgr
        Parameters:
        superUserId - The id of the Super User making the API call
        emailAddress - The email address of the customer being searched
        Returns:
        Returns an array of AdminStores. An empty array is returned if there are no stores.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception
